title: NASA’s “meatball” logo typeface
content: Can anyone tell me what serif typeface was used in NASA’s original “meatball” logo?
author: Forner

comments.content:
What's up with the punctuation in the header?

Can you post a sample?

This has been here before:

[http://typophile.com/node/8624](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041955/http:/typophile.com/node/8624 "http://typophile.com/node/8624")

Probably custom.

I noticed that [Largo Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123041955/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/largo-sb/) resembles this except for weight. I wonder if there was a Largo Black at one time?

- Mike Yanega

I've been doing some digging with PAO at NASA HQ. They confirm that the meatball is a hand-lettered graphic created by one James Modarelli, agency employee, in 1958, in his spare time.

It would indeed make a very cool font.
